discourse_list.title: Crypto Bill Proposal - How would this affect DAI and MakerDAO?

content.content: Senators Kirsten Gillibrand (Democrat) y Cynthia Lummis (Republican), propose a Federal Crypto Bill that establishes that "a depository institution shall maintain high quality liquid assets under this section equal to not less than 100 percent of the face amount of the liabilities of the institution on payment stablecoins issued by the institution"   If this text becomes federal law, would this affect DAI and MakerDAO in some way???   Is MakerDAO an “institution” in terms of this bill proposal?   Will MakerDAO Vaults and Over-Collateralization be considered as “maintain high quality liquid assets under this section equal to not less than 100 percent of the face amount of the liabilities”?    image723×331 72.8 KB  Text: https://www.lummis.senate.gov/wp-content/uploads/Lummis-Gillibrand-Responsible-Financial-Innovation-Act-Final.pdf

Keep in mind this is just a bill. There will be hearings as it goes through committees and subject to change. Further, Senator Toomey has proposed other legislation specifically regarding regarding stablecoins. See Toomey Announces Legislation to Create Responsible Regulatory Framework for Stablecoins | United States Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs The Lummis Gillibrand bill does define a DAO which is nice to see. But I think it is clear that most DAOs will be either incorporating or heavily relying on incorporated entities. That is one thing I took from my quick look at the 70 page proposed bill. Some other notes, not specific to DAOs or stablecoins: Senator Lummis Finishing Crypto Bill - #2 by MFeinberg
